about.title: # about.md
lines: Hello! I am a Computer Science student at the University of Washington - Seattle. I love learning about algorithms and how to make programs efficient. I am currently on a journey to becoming a proficient infrastructure engineer, primarily using C++ through my ongoing systems engineering projects.

What first drew me into programming was game development. Growing up playing video games sparked my curiosity about how they were created. However, it wasn't until university that I finally began to explore this long-standing interest.

projects.title: // --- Project 1: 'Project Adam - Phase 1: The Basics' ---
public: string description = "Phase 1 of Project Adam: 20-month systems engineering roadmap from data structures to distributed systems. "
"Built fundamental data structures and algorithms from first principles in C++17 with manual memory management. "
"Token Bucket and Leaky Bucket rate limiters",

projects.title: // --- Project 2: 'Project Adam - Phases 2-4' ---
public: string description = "Advanced phases of Project Adam covering concurrency, networking protocols, and distributed systems. "
"Currently in Phase 2, also revisiting Phase 1 to implement additional data structures.";
"Phase 2: Lock-Free Data Structures (Completed) - Atomics and ARM memory model",
"Phase 2: Custom Mutex Implementation (In Progress) - Lock/unlock with C atomics",
"Phase 3: DNS Server - Caching resolver with ad-blocking",
"Phase 3: UDP from Scratch - Complete UDP protocol over raw sockets",
"Phase 3: TCP from Scratch - Full TCP implementation with congestion control",
"Phase 4: Distributed CDN/Cache - Multi-region cache nodes with geographic routing",

projects.title: // --- Project 3: 'Web Server' ---
public: string description = "Multi-threaded HTTP/1.1 web server in C++ from scratch for CSE 333. Utilizes a thread pool to manage concurrent client connections over IPv4/IPv6. Includes a full-text search engine in C with a file-based inverted index built from 10,000+ documents and a multi-index query processor with ranked results.";

projects.title: // --- Project 4: 'SupplementIQ' ---
public: string description = "Web application for supplement transparency and information. Engineered a high-throughput moderation workflow to process 500+ daily submissions, featuring real-time permission checks on Vercel via TypeScript caching. Architected a role-based access control (RBAC) system using Supabase RLS and JWT, achieving sub-50ms response times. Includes status updates and automated migration of approved content.";
"Role-based access control (RBAC) with Supabase RLS and JWT",

projects.title: // --- Project 5: 'GradescopePlus' ---
public: string description = "Simple tool for Gradescope that shows assignments due soon and how many days until they are due. Forked a gradescope-api and added the web part so that people can see their assignments easier.";

projects.title: // --- Project 5: 'E-Store' ---
public: string description = "Class project e-commerce platform with product management and SQLite3 database integration.";

hobbies.title: # hobbies.md
lines: I was a competitive swimmer starting at age 11 and continued through high school. Although I stopped competing when I entered college, I still enjoy swimming recreationally from time to time.
I was more serious about lifting in high school, but I still enjoy getting a good workout in. There's something satisfying about pushing yourself in the gym.
I love learning about new gym supplements and trying them out. I find the science behind supplementation fascinating and enjoy experimenting with what works best for my body.
I'm a huge fan of atmospheric horror games. Some of my favorites include Dead Space, Silent Hill 2, and Resident Evil 7. I love the tension and storytelling that horror games deliver.
I also enjoy Japanese role-playing games, particularly the Persona series and Final Fantasy. The combination of engaging narratives, character development, and strategic combat really draws me in.

I enjoy investing in the stock market and find learning about financial markets, economic trends, and investment strategies to be incredibly fascinating. It's a continuous learning process that I find both challenging and rewarding.
My favorite dog breed is the **Shiba Inu**!

technicalSkills.title: # technical-skills.md
lines: C++ 17, C 11, Java 11, Python 3.13, SQL, JavaScript, TypeScript,
React, Node.js, Flask, REST APIs, API Design
Git, Version Control, Visual Studio Code, neovim, Terminal, Linux/Windows Environment
